citations.narrative:
The facility's two primary enclosures housing waterfowl do not contain adequate aquatic areas. The inspector observed a
water bowl but no pool in one enclosure housing three ducks. A second enclosure housing the rest of the waterfowl (15
ducks, 9 geese, and one swan) contained one shallow wading pool. The inspector observed one bird in the pool
surrounded by 3-5 birds who were vocalizing and behaving aggressively towards the bird in the pool. One of the
aggressive birds replaced the bird that was bathing. The facility stated these are temporary primary enclosures meant to
house the animals for approximately 8 months while their permanent enclosures are renovated.
Lack of appropriate aquatic areas can lead to injuries from aggression, and can affect the birds' overall physical and
behavioral health.
Correct by: Providing an aquatic area and a dry area that allows easy ingress and egress. Pools must be of sufficient
surface area and depth to allow each bird to make normal postural and social adjustments, such as immersion, bathing,
swimming, and foraging, with freedom to escape from aggression demonstrated by other birds in the enclosure. Dry areas
must be of sufficient size to allow each bird to make normal postural and social adjustments with adequate freedom of
movement and freedom to escape from aggression demonstrated by other birds in the enclosure.
Correction Date: December 31, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.153(c) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The facility's two primary enclosures housing waterfowl do not contain adequate aquatic areas. The inspector observed a 
water bowl but no pool in one enclosure housing three ducks. A second enclosure housing the rest of the waterfowl (15 
ducks, 9 geese, and one swan) contained one shallow wading pool. The inspector observed one bird in the pool 
surrounded by 3-5 birds who were vocalizing and behaving aggressively towards the bird in the pool. One of the 
aggressive birds replaced the bird that was bathing. The facility stated these are temporary primary enclosures meant to 
house the animals for approximately 8 months while their permanent enclosures are renovated. 
 
Lack of appropriate aquatic areas can lead to injuries from aggression, and can affect the birds' overall physical and 
behavioral health. 
 
Correct by: Providing an aquatic area and a dry area that allows easy ingress and egress. Pools must be of sufficient 
surface area and depth to allow each bird to make normal postural and social adjustments, such as immersion, bathing, 
swimming, and foraging, with freedom to escape from aggression demonstrated by other birds in the enclosure. Dry areas 
must be of sufficient size to allow each bird to make normal postural and social adjustments with adequate freedom of 
movement and freedom to escape from aggression demonstrated by other birds in the enclosure.  
 
Correction Date: December 31, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
